title: Shepeard's Hotel luggage label logo
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701150358im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Shepheards_label1_4595.jpg)
  
I'd like to use this label as the basis for a poster design for a production of Agatha Christie's Murder on the Nile. Haven't got anything on my machine, had a look through Indentifont and WTF with no joy, so found this site recommended on a blog here [http://www.webhostingreviewboards.com/design/5-famous-font-recognition-t...](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701150358/http:/www.webhostingreviewboards.com/design/5-famous-font-recognition-tools-and-my-personal-experience/ "http://www.webhostingreviewboards.com/design/5-famous-font-recognition-tools-and-my-personal-experience/") and thought I'd ask, very nicely, if anyone could help. Design is for a penurious amateur drama company, so free would be nice, but not essential...  
Thanks in advance  
Mike
author: mrpg

comments.content:
Good Art Deco lettering, but no exact match as a font.  
But for the penurious amateur drama company here are three free substitutes Mouse Deco [http://www.dafont.com/mouse-deco.font?text=CARIOEGYPTSHEPARDSHOTEL](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701150358/http:/www.dafont.com/mouse-deco.font?text=CARIOEGYPTSHEPARDSHOTEL "http://www.dafont.com/mouse-deco.font?text=CARIOEGYPTSHEPARDSHOTEL") Market Deco [http://www.dafont.com/market-deco.font?text=CARIOEGYPTSHEPARDSHOTEL](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701150358/http:/www.dafont.com/market-deco.font?text=CARIOEGYPTSHEPARDSHOTEL "http://www.dafont.com/market-deco.font?text=CARIOEGYPTSHEPARDSHOTEL") and Caviar Dreams [http://www.dafont.com/caviar-dreams.font?text=CARIOEGYPTSHEPARDSHOTEL](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701150358/http:/www.dafont.com/caviar-dreams.font?text=CARIOEGYPTSHEPARDSHOTEL "http://www.dafont.com/caviar-dreams.font?text=CARIOEGYPTSHEPARDSHOTEL")  
Don

The bold weight of the budget priced Concurso Italian  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/btn/concurso-italian-btn/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701150358/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/btn/concurso-italian-btn/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/btn/concurso-italian-btn/") would be a better fit, particularly if you expand the width.  
Don
I like Storm [AbaldA](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701150358/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/abalda) for the top one.

Thanks, all. It's a piece of hand lettering, I guess - going by the variations in the E and S, if nothing else - but I'll give the suggestions a go. In essence, looking for something in and Art Deco stylie that doesn't make people yawn... :)

Polon might give you some of the feel:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/borutta/polon/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701150358/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/borutta/polon/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/borutta/polon/")

[http://origin.myfonts.net/s/aw/original/211/0/108232.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701150358/http:/origin.myfonts.net/s/aw/original/211/0/108232.png "http://origin.myfonts.net/s/aw/original/211/0/108232.png")
